alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Piscataquis; Northern Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southeast Aroostook; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 3:05PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TUESDAY TO 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, and Penobscot Valley Maine * WHEN...From 2 PM Tuesday to 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
